intro: Leptochilus platyphyllus, commonly known as the broad-leafed leptochilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually clustered in inflorescences, often with vibrant colors attracting pollinators. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
